Effect The creature struck by the foot is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and held in place. As long as the tyrannosaurus doesn't move from its position, the pinned creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

A tyrannosaurus gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack a creature it has pinned in this manner but can only Swallow Whole if that creature is grabbed with its jaws.

sPnji5oOyb1NaOAA.name: Site Bound
sPnji5oOyb1NaOAA.description: A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

z294ZgeVIeaVpYTW.name: Rejuvenation
z294ZgeVIeaVpYTW.description: When defeated, The Caretaker returns in 1 hour, unless he is released with a @Check[religion|dc:22] check or convinced that the PCs are friendly with a @Check[diplomacy|dc:16] check.

U405VDoNIkMc9Zva.name: Inhabit Object
U405VDoNIkMc9Zva.description: The Caretaker possess an object of size Large or smaller within 20 feet, making it an animated object (maximum level 1). If the target object is being held by a creature, the bearer can attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] save to prevent the possession. The possession ends when the object is destroyed or the Caretaker leaves it. At this point, the Caretaker reappears in the object's square and can't Inhabit an Object again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Inhabit an Object]]{1d4 rounds}.

Weak Wood Wisp.name: Weak Wood Wisp
Weak Wood Wisp.description:
Like other wisps, wood wisps roam their plane and attune to other wisps, wandering with them in symphonies. Because of their willingness to bond, wood wisps appear outside their home plane more than other wood elementals, though they're still relatively rare compared to other wisps.

Wood wisps resemble coconuts trailed by thick nests of branches that cover and conceal even deeper webs of thorny vines. They are, unfortunately, both unaware of the pain these thorns can cause fleshy creatures and very physically affectionate in their eagerness to offer assistance.

9gAaXXK7fWFvAfU8.name: Accord Essence
9gAaXXK7fWFvAfU8.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet that benefited from the wisp's resonance in the last hour is targeted by an attack

Effect The wisp detonates itself in a small elemental explosion of leaves and pollen. This gives temporary Hit Points equal to half the wisp's current HP to all allies within 30 feet that have benefited from the wisp's resonance aura in the past hour. These temporary Hit Points last 1 hour.

A wisp that uses this reaction is permanently destroyed and can be restored only by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual or similarly powerful effect. If an ability would prevent the wisp's destruction (for instance, if the wisp is summoned and would merely be dismissed), Accord Essence has no effect.

Y9gukafwaFEAEqG0.name: Resonance
Y9gukafwaFEAEqG0.description:
30 feet.

All wisps vibrate at a frequency attuned to their element, resonating with and empowering all creatures and effects sharing that trait. A creature in the area gains a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for effects with the plant or wood trait; a creature with the elemental trait and either plant trait or wood trait gains this bonus to all attack and damage rolls. For wood wisps, this bonus also applies to nonmagical wooden weapons, such as staves and clubs.

cM7y0IGI7NQFI9f3.name: In Concert
cM7y0IGI7NQFI9f3.description: When a wood wisp rolls a critical failure on a check to Aid, they get a failure instead, and when they roll a success, they get a critical success instead.

LQwIeFmRujywT6zT.name: Cowardly Flight
LQwIeFmRujywT6zT.description:
Trigger An enemy enters into melee range of Minister Jo

Frequency once per hour

Effect Minister Jo is not a fighter and would prefer to be safely behind his bodyguards. He flees, Striding up to his Speed, and he must end his movement closer to the Appraiser than when he started. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}, he can Reload his sukgung and then fire it backward over his shoulder in a panic, attempting a sukgung Strike against the triggering creature.

b9FQMGhETCHSDlXK.name: Expensive Reload
b9FQMGhETCHSDlXK.description:
Requirements Minister Jo has expensive bolts

Effect Minister Jo supplements his mediocre fighting ability with a variety of cheaply sourced magical items. He Reloads his sukgung with an expensive bolt and activates its magic, imbuing his next sukgung Strike with one of the following effects.

  • Shuffling Bolt (teleportation) If the bolt hits a target, the target and Minister Jo swap places. If the triggering hit was a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round after the teleportation.
  • Snare Bolt If the bolt hits a target, silk webbing wraps around them, imposing a –10-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds for [[/gmr 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}, or until they [[/act escape dc=25]] against a DC of 25. On a critical hit, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes.
  • Spark Bolt (electricity) The bolt deals an additional @Damage[(2d12[splash])[electricity]] damage.

9tVyGfBUHb3AJZmy.name: Telepathy (100 feet)
9tVyGfBUHb3AJZmy.description: A monster with telepathy can communicate mentally with any creatures within the listed radius, as long as they share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts, and communicates no more information than normal speech would.

prtTIT0LyapARhoz.name: Hope Vulnerability
prtTIT0LyapARhoz.description: The elegecide is fueled by the certainty of doom, which leaves it weakened by any hope. The first time each round that a creature critically fails at an attack or skill check against the elegecide, it experiences a burst of hope that leaves it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

y53eOVRvnut1jdIQ.name: Doom Aura
y53eOVRvnut1jdIQ.description:
30 feet

The elegecide constantly emits telepathic warnings about future dangers and harm. When a non-demon creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

6nmHe20KIytqxeJS.name: Dorsal Lash
6nmHe20KIytqxeJS.description:
The elegecide lashes out with its trailing dorsal fins, looping them around a target within 15 feet. It sends a burst of telepathic information about all the possible ways the target can be injured in the next minute. The target takes @Damage[(1d4+2)[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the elegecide.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the elegecide.

PQhHUj7dXqDiETws.name: Blades of Shade
PQhHUj7dXqDiETws.description: Shadow Lesolethe causes the shadows cast by those around her to transform into a mesh of blades which erupt upwards at her foes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Enemy creatures in the area take @Damage[4d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save).

vKHq35aOubDlbfbC.name: Boiling Darkness
vKHq35aOubDlbfbC.description: Shadow Lesolethe utters a scream which causes shadows to churn and boil. Each living enemy within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to Boiling Darkness for 1 minute.

8yj4qvRSHNMZp5kI.name: Skitter
8yj4qvRSHNMZp5kI.description: The origami cockroach flies up to its speed toward a creature. If the creature is larger than it, the origami cockroach enters its space and gains cover, skittering about the target. This cover lasts until it or the target moves, causing them to cease sharing a space.

1lMfclHhDDu7nudH.name: Repair Nanites (Fast Healing 7)
1lMfclHhDDu7nudH.description: The brain guzzler has integrated nanites that swarm over damage, healing it.

VGtxQgR50RgNXgLv.name: Cybernetics
VGtxQgR50RgNXgLv.description: The cybernetics of a brain guzzler can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful [[/act disable-device dc=22]] check. A brain guzzler's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A brain guzzler with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Ww1mMdRu5yJSpaYj.name: Guzzle
Ww1mMdRu5yJSpaYj.description:
Trigger The brain guzzler kills an enemy

Effect The brain guzzler breaks open its victim's skull and eats the brain. The brain guzzler gains knowledge of the victim's memories, and its Intelligence increases by +1. The victim can no longer be raised from the dead by any method that requires an intact corpse and rises as a zombie shambler the next day at dawn.

0iKagCxTDFf1p9SV.name: Bog Rot
0iKagCxTDFf1p9SV.description:
This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can the damage from it be healed, until it's successfully treated with remove curse or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by bog rot melts into a noxious sludge and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

OBpiSvaf3hSmsvXL.name: Deskari's Rage
OBpiSvaf3hSmsvXL.description: Amriya tightens hir group on Rotcarver and attempts a powerful Strike against hir enemy. On a success, ze deals an additional 1d10 piercing damage.

cgZ2ARrsevGLRMN7.name: Rot and Ruin
cgZ2ARrsevGLRMN7.description: Amriya's mouth opens, spewing forth a vapor that triggers rot and decay. All creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] must attempt a basic @Check[fortitude|dc:25] saving throw or take @Damage[3d12[void]] damage. On a critical failure, creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} for 1 minute.

w4vyvwaM9qNoOdVg.name: Giant Wasp Venom
w4vyvwaM9qNoOdVg.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 no effect (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)

xvarDE8f528NdSjL.name: Implant Eggs
xvarDE8f528NdSjL.description: The Vespiria lays eggs in an adjacent creature that is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, exposing it to wasp larva disease.

sKJOM5v5CkJwAzYb.name: To Me, My Minions
sKJOM5v5CkJwAzYb.description: The vespiria queen has complete control over wasps within 30 feet. All giant wasps or wasp swarms in range can make a free attack on a target within melee range as normal.

8KPW4LTQP7yrPNJY.name: Wasp Larva
8KPW4LTQP7yrPNJY.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1d6 days)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1d3 days)

Stage 3 @Damage[5d6[untyped]] damage, larva emerges (disease ends)

5LW09EsmHz4skLa7.name: Brimstone Blink
5LW09EsmHz4skLa7.description: Marius makes a quick hop through the Pit to reappear close to an enemy in a cloud of brimstone and ash. Marius teleports to any square within 15 feet that is within reach of another creature, then makes a melee Strike against one creature within his reach. This movement does not provoke reactions.

DBcfcUWx2wI4tUj6.name: Spellstrip Strike
DBcfcUWx2wI4tUj6.description: Marius specializes in using a spellcaster's own spells against them. He makes a melee attack against an enemy, dealing damage as normal. If the melee attack succeeds, he can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} action to attempt to take one of the enemy's prepared spells or unused spontaneous spell slots. If successful, Marius gains a temporary spontaneous spell slot for the stolen spell until the end of his next turn. Determine the stolen spell at random from the target's spells that are 1st-rank. Innate spells, focus spells, and cantrips cannot be stolen in this manner.

JzPo3j8Ai0TyOMVO.name: Unnoticeable Guile
JzPo3j8Ai0TyOMVO.description: The Chelaxian assassin is an expert at maintaining perfect stillness and blending into their surroundings. Each non-ally creature who has not been targeted by or subject to an attack or effect made by the Chelaxian assassin must, at the start of their turn, succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save (@Check[will|dc:28] in dungeon environments while the Chelaxian assassin is wearing their camouflage suit) or the Chelaxian assassin becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them. This effect ends if the Chelaxian assassin moves without Sneaking or takes any hostile action against the non-ally creature. This does not prevent a creature from making Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, making the assassin Observed as normal on a success.

EwnTH8rlknL4HtGv.name: +2 to Perception to Detect Snares and Hazards

hrKTUcRzWZm5Qhmc.name: Devilish Feint
hrKTUcRzWZm5Qhmc.description: When the Chelaxian assassin successfully Feints, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the Chelaxian assassin's weapon attacks until the end of the Chelaxian assassin's next turn. On a critical success, the target is off-guard against all weapon attacks for that time, not just the Chelaxian assassin's.

5htRdF1rfm6GJpZW.name: Sneak Attack
5htRdF1rfm6GJpZW.description: The Chelaxian assassin deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

7Ogm29t4rEPoNaQE.name: Strike of Terror
7Ogm29t4rEPoNaQE.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian assassin is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from the target of this ability

Effect The Chelaxian assassin makes a Strike with a dagger. If they hit and deal damage, the damaged creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical hit).

Pathfinder Sentinel.name: Pathfinder Sentinel
Pathfinder Sentinel.description: When a creature dies, and for whatever reason its spirit is unable or unwilling to leave the site of its death, that spirit may manifest as a poltergeist: a restless, invisible spirit that is still able to manipulate physical objects. Many poltergeists perished in a way that resulted from or led to extreme emotional trauma.

Yi4K7PbKaZWlXxWj.name: Site Bound
Yi4K7PbKaZWlXxWj.description: A Pathfinder sentinel is tied to the wreck of the Whippoorwill and can't travel more than 120 feet from it.

smEk0yh1Pe95Nvsc.name: Natural Invisibility
smEk0yh1Pe95Nvsc.description: A poltergeist is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. It becomes visible only when it uses Frighten.

pvdHMw62l3uanob8.name: Rejuvenation
pvdHMw62l3uanob8.description: When a poltergeist is destroyed, it reforms, fully healed, where it was destroyed after [[/br 2d4 #Rejuvenation]]{2d4 days}. A poltergeist can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

KZ4sC23Z3r4PS4V6.name: Telekinetic Defense
KZ4sC23Z3r4PS4V6.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of the poltergeist

Effect The poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the triggering creature.

v8X1W0LmbkWRpOS6.name: Frighten
v8X1W0LmbkWRpOS6.description:
Requirements The poltergeist must be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}

Effect The poltergeist becomes visible, appearing as a skeletal, ghostlike humanoid. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a failure. On a critical failure, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as it's frightened. On a success, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

At the start of its next turn, the poltergeist becomes invisible again.

RJlLjrzqdXREWyPR.name: Telekinetic Storm
RJlLjrzqdXREWyPR.description:
The poltergeist telekinetically throws numerous small objects, such as rocks and pieces of wreckage, either spreading them out among multiple foes or directing them at one target.

  • When this effect is spread out among multiple foes, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike at a -2 penalty against each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet}. These count as one attack for the poltergeist's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.
  • When this effect has only one target, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the target, and the damage increases to 3d12. It deals @Damage[1d12[untyped]] damage on a failure, and no damage on a critical failure.

Pusk (PFS 6-00).name: Pusk (PFS 6-00)
Pusk (PFS 6-00).description:
Among the lowest and least powerful of all demons, the wretched pusks are just as vicious and cruel as their more powerful brethren. They happily vent their frustrations on anything weaker than themselves.

Born from the souls of the slothful, these demons appear vaguely humanoid in appearance with awkward limbs and slack lumps of skin hanging from their frames. Supposedly, a single slothful soul of sufficient depravity and strength can spawn an entire horde of these creatures. However, as weaker demons, their lot in life is to suffer at the hands of more powerful Abyssal predators, and only a tiny number of pusks ever manage to become something more. For this reason, pusks are quite accommodating when summoned by mortals. They're usually content to work under conditions few other fiends would accept, although they'll still gladly turn on even the kindest of masters who show even the slightest hint of weakness.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.

p6uToNU7wgFDgDDH.name: Sloth
p6uToNU7wgFDgDDH.description:
When a pusk regains their actions, roll [[/gmr 1d4 #Actions Regained]]{1d4}. The pusk regains that many actions for the turn (to a maximum of 3, or 2 if the pusk is a minion).

Effects like the slowed condition can further reduce their number of actions.

Lb8baU3vfeAtn1Nw.name: Cower
Lb8baU3vfeAtn1Nw.description: The pusk makes itself as small as possible, protecting its vital organs with its limbs. It gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC but takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls. This lasts until the pusk moves from its current space, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or ends the effect as a free action.

h8caQJMnKj4F22zZ.name: Frenzied Slashes
h8caQJMnKj4F22zZ.description: The pusk makes three claw Strikes, each at a –2 penalty, all targeting the same creature. The pusk's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it has made all three attacks. The pusk gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} condition until the beginning of its next turn.

xdQJFj57QglkQXeG.name: Vicious Criticals
xdQJFj57QglkQXeG.description: A pusk makes the most of any weakness it finds. Whenever a pusk scores a critical hit with its claw Strike, the target takes an additional @Damage[1d6[bleed]]{1d6 persistent bleed} damage.

ugREgWQ7cVGxqn3h.name: Bursting Pustules
ugREgWQ7cVGxqn3h.description:
Trigger The zombie takes piercing damage or damage from a critical hit

Effect The pustules covering the zombie's flesh rupture, covering adjacent creatures with vile fluid. Creatures adjacent to the zombie become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save.

hYcrjabm50sPyqBV.name: Pack Attack
hYcrjabm50sPyqBV.description: The lion deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the lion's allies.

LxnGNDFd9yCEkOAt.name: Pounce
LxnGNDFd9yCEkOAt.description: The lion Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the lion began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

G9RDOnk58z4e0Mof.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 8)
G9RDOnk58z4e0Mof.description: The automatic greeter has Hardness. Once the automatic greeter is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 18.

Plaguetooth.name: Plaguetooth
Plaguetooth.description:
Lone fairies usually need several minutes of elbow grease and a sleeping or restrained subject to extract a tooth.

Tooth fairies spawn when a child's tooth (or, less commonly, an entire child) is buried in terrain rife with fey energies. Hatching from the buried teeth like larvae from an egg, tooth fairies build crude pliers from whatever they can find, then go hunting for more teeth—regardless of the owners' willingness.

04WUnuVaMwggkQxr.name: Plaque Burst
04WUnuVaMwggkQxr.description: When killed, a tooth fairy bursts into sticky, foul-smelling white dust. Each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:5] must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

2kSrspDPmUktGvBB.name: Tooth Tug
2kSrspDPmUktGvBB.description:
Requirements The tooth fairy's last action was a successful pliers Strike against a creature with teeth

Effect The tooth fairy attempts a @Check[thievery|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC, dealing @Damage[2[bleed]] damage on any result but a critical failure. On a critical success, it also pulls out one of the target's teeth.

If the creature loses a tooth, it takes a –1 status penalty to Charisma-based skill checks and must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] to Cast a Spell unless that spell has the subtle trait. These effects last for 1 day, or until the stolen tooth is returned and the target regains at least 1 Hit Point.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4q8Of8NM9DC8kWyK]{Effect: Tooth Tug}

Gruasha.name: Gruasha
Gruasha.description:
Shadow giants are natives of the Netherworld, where they have dwelled in perpetual twilight for millennia. They live in familiar groups and uphold a nomadic way of life as they roam across ancestral lands between shadowy forests and misty chasms. These hunter-gatherers pass down lore through oral histories, conduct pilgrimages to unholy ziggurats of black stone, and bathe in the blood of their long-standing foes, including rival shadow giant clans and fiends of the Netherworld intent on enslaving their kind.

Standing 15 feet tall, with gray skin and hair only a shade lighter, shadow giants are fearsome foes with a well-earned reputation as zealous warmongers and ruthless combatants. They rarely interact with outsiders, though they may treat with proven warriors who show the giants the respect and deference they feel they deserve.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

WsGuoYeAA0yWHOXE.name: Pall of Shadow
WsGuoYeAA0yWHOXE.description: When a shadow giant hits with a melee attack, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and take a –1 status penalty to Perception checks involving sight as long as they remain drained. On a critical failure, this condition doesn't heal naturally and can be removed only with magic.

CFQjHuIFlshnvM7H.name: Shadow Chain
CFQjHuIFlshnvM7H.description: Shadows extend the giant's chain as they make a spiked chain Strike, increasing their reach to 60 feet for that Strike. If this hits, the target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30] save or be teleported to an empty space within the shadow giant's normal reach.

PDPYyeFFpfksUoXK.name: Shadowcloak
PDPYyeFFpfksUoXK.description: The shadow giant gains the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3JG1t3T4mWn6vTke]{Blur} spell for 1 minute or until they are exposed to direct sunlight, whichever comes first.

QOT0UbjPYnIIySH9.name: +2 on All Saves Against Divine Magic

r0C8GUjKqvNfnURR.name: Aura of Command
r0C8GUjKqvNfnURR.description: 30 feet. As captain of the Pure Legion, Nanaeil bolsters the lower-level legionnaires under his command, granting them a +1 status bonus to their attack rolls and +2 status bonus to their will saves.

jr5CFCk4BfGaQErO.name: Dual-Weapon Warrior
jr5CFCk4BfGaQErO.description: Pitros Nanaeil is highly trained in the art of wielding two weapons at once, preferring to wield the +1 striking scimitar in his main hand and the bloodletting kukri in his off-hand.

2byeGaISmswuUpxU.name: May No Mortal Be Beholden
2byeGaISmswuUpxU.description: When Captain Nanaeil rolls a success on a save against an effect or spell from the divine tradition, they get a critical success instead.

liIsPsXqsjby7neR.name: Twin Riposte
liIsPsXqsjby7neR.description:
Trigger A creature within your reach critically fails to Strike you.

A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon. Make a melee Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against the triggering opponent.

4LPO8MfLTdkoM9NV.name: Double Slice
4LPO8MfLTdkoM9NV.description: Nanaeil lashes out at his foe with both weapons. He makes two Strikes, one with each melee weapon, each using his current multiple attack penalty. Both Strikes must have the same target. If both attacks hit, combine their damage, then add any other applicable effects from both weapons. Precision damage is added only once. Combine the damage from both Strikes and apply resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as two attacks when calculating his multiple attack penalty.

NQMFcbNx3quS2mgG.name: Smite Divine
NQMFcbNx3quS2mgG.description: The Pure Legion's scimitars have been enchanted specifically to take down divine spellcasters. Melee Strikes against clerics, champions, and other creatures capable of casting divine spells do an additional 2d6 mental damage.

Shadowpact Statue.name: Shadowpact Statue
Shadowpact Statue.description:
Animated statues are often used to guard crypts, small shrines, or areas in government buildings where they can be positioned amid normal statues to hide their true nature until an intruder arouses their ire. Many less scrupulous adventurers, fueled by paranoia that statues will animate and attack, smash any statues they encounter, ruining harmless, ancient relics.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

dkfqFFDoPeLbQKNp.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
dkfqFFDoPeLbQKNp.description: Like normal objects, a shadowpact statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a shadowpact statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 22.

T0JcrrU5zyi61Zeh.name: Brazier
T0JcrrU5zyi61Zeh.description: The statue carries a wide brazier full of hot coals. To make flaming coal Strikes or use Burn Alive, the statue must have the brazier held in one hand or otherwise within reach. Instead of targeting the statue with an attack, a creature can target the brazier directly. The brazier has the same AC and saves as the statue. Dealing @Damage[15[cold]] damage to the brazier or dousing it with at least 2 gallons of water extinguishes the coals. This prevents the statue from using Burn Alive and causes its ranged attacks to no longer deal fire damage.

YLEBJdSlLikGbKMn.name: Burn Alive
YLEBJdSlLikGbKMn.description: The statue grinds a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} into the red-hot coals of its brazier. The target takes @Damage[3d8[fire]] damage and @Damage[1d8[persistent,fire]] damage.

dOlE012wah1QqChP.name: Mythic Ferocity
dOlE012wah1QqChP.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The shadowpact statue is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 3}

Trigger The shadowpact statue is reduced to 0 HP

Effect The shadowpact statue avoids being knocked out and remains at half its maximum HP, but its wounded value increases by 1.

Gluttonous Geode (Quest 22).name: Gluttonous Geode (Quest 22)
Gluttonous Geode (Quest 22).description:
The vast ranks of earth elementals have been slow to respond to the return of the elemental lords and the Planes of Metal and Wood. These events have not broken the mountains, nor have they blown away the sands.

Earthy Emotions

Earth elementals talk even less than most elementals. They're ponderous, weighing decisions so slowly they can crush the energy from a discussion. Their foremost concern is whether a situation can be endured. Though a rare or resplendent treasure might entice an earth elemental, it's difficult to spur any sense of urgency in them without the presence of an immediate threat.

iiNeC7jyAcDS6aGh.name: Attach
iiNeC7jyAcDS6aGh.description: The geode Leaps up to 15 feet and makes a crystal teeth Strike. If it hits a creature larger than itself, it can attach to that creature. Doing so is like Grabbing the creature (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 17), but the geode moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. The geode is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while attached. If the geode is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature, that creature takes @Damage[1[bleed]]{1 persistent bleed} damage. Escaping the attached geode or removing the geode in other ways doesn't cause bleed damage.

JQEFb9KA6XUO7dyb.name: Gnaw
JQEFb9KA6XUO7dyb.description:
Requirements The geode is attached to a creature

Effect The geode deals @Damage[(1d4+2)[bludgeoning]] damage to the creature it's attached to (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save).

qWNxjCGkNzFWuJsx.name: Consume Flesh
qWNxjCGkNzFWuJsx.description: Averill devours his raw fish and regains @Damage[4d6[healing]] Hit Points.

VevwO6BlBLu9jVZA.name: Grave Tidings
VevwO6BlBLu9jVZA.description:
Requirement A grabbed, paralyzed, restrained, or unconscious creature is within Averill's reach

Effect Averill whispers into the creature's ears, compelling them to join him. The creature is unable to attack Averill Quint for the duration, unless Averill uses a hostile action against them, and any undead Pathfinder can treat the creature as an ally for purposes of flanking. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The curse lasts 1 round.

Critical Failure The curse lasts 2 rounds.

Q5Qd599tQTMtgOYk.name: Swift Stroke
Q5Qd599tQTMtgOYk.description: Averill swims up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

9PyQKrYhwwi2TOSM.name: Averill's Orders
9PyQKrYhwwi2TOSM.description:
Frequency once per round;

Effect Averill orders an ally to attack or to get in position. The ally can immediately Strike or move up to half its swim Speed. If it moves, the movement does not trigger reactions.

TwYtLCynQGJg3nk1.name: Familiar
TwYtLCynQGJg3nk1.description: Oloranvis's familiar is a poppet elkhound named Ruditgar. His Speed is 40 feet. He has poppet immunities and weakness 4 to fire. When Oloranvis Casts or Sustains a hex, she can cause ice to form in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] centered on Ruditgar's square. Those squares are difficult terrain until the start of her next turn. Ruditgar and Oloranvis communicate telepathically through touch.

dxArJTSJ6RRIxiw7.name: Eldritch Nails
dxArJTSJ6RRIxiw7.description: Oloranvis's razor-sharp nails sparkle with the residue of her winter magic. Her unarmed nail strikes cause both cold and slashing damage.

3bZlb8W3112ozsBC.name: Winter's Gift
3bZlb8W3112ozsBC.description: Oloranvis has an unusually strong connection to winter magic even for a winter witch. When she casts a spell with the cold trait, she gains a +1 status bonus to the spell DC or spell attack.

Elite Congealed Magic.name: Elite Congealed Magic
Elite Congealed Magic.description:
Found underground or in dungeons, these quivering, slug-like ropes of slime continuously scour their domain for food. In addition to their shape, they are named for their ability to shoot out expanding ribbons of slime that resemble tangled strings.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

LIfeVtjLRBsBRIF5.name: Motion Sense
LIfeVtjLRBsBRIF5.description: Congealed magic can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

UlW5OHvaMswBBNb1.name: Split
UlW5OHvaMswBBNb1.description: Whenever a congealed magic would take slashing damage (if it weren't immune) and has at least 10 HP, it splits into two identical oozes with half the original's HP. One congealed magic is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, move smaller creatures and objects out of the way to make a space or the split is canceled at the GM's discretion.

txSoRn67SYcT0oVZ.name: Tag Team
txSoRn67SYcT0oVZ.description:
Requirements another congealed magic is within 30 feet

Effect The ooze arcs magical essence to the other congealed magic. Creatures in that line take @Damage[(3d6-2)[void]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save. A creature that fails its save is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

tzydi1Wnb5t5NOq4.name: Gang Up
tzydi1Wnb5t5NOq4.description: Silver Devil hooligans benefit from flanking a creature as long as at least two other Silver Devil hooligans are adjacent to that creature.

DyXTFnUImaBRP7NF.name: Sneak Attack
DyXTFnUImaBRP7NF.description: A Silver Devil hooligan deals 1d6 additional damage to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} opponent.

X6hOrjB6TIyhyMQ5.name: Bravado Aversion
X6hOrjB6TIyhyMQ5.description: A gargarthezul can't stand to be shown up. The first time each round a creature successfully Demoralizes, Shoves, or Trips a gargarthezul, it takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage.

yRpNZFLbeUdqHQ8H.name: Bully
yRpNZFLbeUdqHQ8H.description: The gargarthezul @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoves} a creature, and Strides after it into the nearest adjacent square if successful. It then makes a tentacle Strike against the creature, using the same multiple attack penalty.

8eumTeww6536avGC.name: Halyard Swing
8eumTeww6536avGC.description:
Requirements The gargarthezul is on the deck of a ship.

Effect The gargarthezul swings from a nearby rope, moving up to twice its Speed and ignoring any terrain or lack of surface beneath it. It can make a tentacle Strike at any point during this movement.

QlktgKrcecMqG2Sa.name: Mark of Avarice
QlktgKrcecMqG2Sa.description:
Requirements The gargarthezul's last action was a successful tentacle Strike.

Effect The gargarthezul places a brand on the creature it hit that fills the creature's mind with overwhelming urges towards piracy. The creature doesn't treat anyone as their ally and can't Delay or Ready. They must use all of their actions to attempt to Disarm, or Demoralize, targeting a creature randomly determined by the GM (they may use actions to facilitate their attempts, such as to move to the target or to drop an item so they have a free hand). The duration is based on a @Check[will|dc:15] save. If the creature successfully Disarms or Demoralizes their target, they can attempt a @Check[flat|dc:11] check to recover from Mark of Avarice. The gargarthezul may only have one mark of avarice in effect at any given time. An additional mark placed causes the previous one to fade.

Critical Success The creature becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The mark lasts for 1 round.

Critical Failure The mark lasts for 1 minute.

Jio6rOXycNZ50qmQ.name: Vicious Bluster
Jio6rOXycNZ50qmQ.description:
When a gargarthezul successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralizes} a foe, it gains 1d6 temporary Hit Points (2d6 on a critical success) that last for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.P8LdA05tK20u98MF]{Effect: Vicious Bluster}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Ty2YFxv2EDBOSjxl]{Effect: Vicious Bluster (Critical Success)}

Pathfinder Protector.name: Pathfinder Protector
Pathfinder Protector.description:
Ghouls stalkers are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.name: Consume Flesh
7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

jShRo5PDthe4aFDT.name: Ghoul Whispers
jShRo5PDthe4aFDT.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature is within the ghoul's reach

Effect The ghoul whispers dark thoughts and vile cravings into the creature's ears. The creature must save against the forbidden cravings curse.

Forbidden Cravings (curse)

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:17|traits:curse]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effects (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} until it consumes raw meat (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2

Stage 4 as stage 2 unless the target has consumed raw meat in the past 24 hours, then it takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} until it consumes raw meat;

Stage 5 if the creature has eaten raw meat in the past 24 hours, it dies and rises as a ghoul, if not, it returns to stage 4

rvraBop9oOSwcjkq.name: Swift Stroke
rvraBop9oOSwcjkq.description: The ghoul swims up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

otEMzcVHDHX5YfRu.name: Slow
otEMzcVHDHX5YfRu.description: A zombie crow swarm is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} and can't use reactions.

jsalsV7M0TcVLPaZ.name: Swarming Pecks
jsalsV7M0TcVLPaZ.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save)

Shadowpact Vampire.name: Shadowpact Vampire
Shadowpact Vampire.description:
Vampire masterminds are evil wizards who control entire cabals of the undead and instill fear in the hearts of mortals far and wide.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
Shadowpact Vampire.hpdetails: coffin restoration, fast healing 10, void healing

I0GaQls3ghJMJ5Ib.name: Children of the Night
I0GaQls3ghJMJ5Ib.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.6wPW2dvpt86Ou6bL]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.BN5Lb6IsQ9Wyu3rL]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

9iYmbVoVyCe6SNu9.name: Coffin Restoration
9iYmbVoVyCe6SNu9.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

S7Khn0wjpXjjyPAp.name: Mist Escape
S7Khn0wjpXjjyPAp.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. They can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

They automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if they reaches their coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

GXr4u9s0uuvI5J6d.name: Vampire Vulnerabilities
GXr4u9s0uuvI5J6d.description:
All vampires possess the following vulnerabilities. Shadowpact vampires lack a typical vampire's vulnerability to sunlight.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures with strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless they're transported while they hide within their coffin, nor can they enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions—a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome their compulsion just as they do their revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a deity with a holy sanctification option. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so, and it remains brandished for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of their revulsion, they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of their revulsion until they end an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of their revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, they overcome their revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents them from healing above 0 HP, even in their coffin. Staking a vampire requires 3 actions and works only if the vampire is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if they're in their coffin, the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with holy water while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.

zEz9gGlpNBUnyF2Y.name: Change Shape
zEz9gGlpNBUnyF2Y.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

  • Giant Bat
    • Senses echolocation 40 feet,
    • Speed 20 feet, fly 30 feet,
    • Melee fangs +19 Damage 2d8+9 piercing

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

NrOC0MiULczUiNCV.name: Deadly Striker
NrOC0MiULczUiNCV.description: The shadowpact vampire deals an additional 1d6 precision damage on their next Strike whenever they use an action to Stride 10 or more feet.

3ZSVEZBMKleuEd84.name: Dominate
3ZSVEZBMKleuEd84.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait (@Check[will|dc:]). The save DC uses the high spell DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

9ewh7tMyC0NRIpZx.name: Drain Bonded Item
9ewh7tMyC0NRIpZx.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The vampire mastermind hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect The vampire expends the power stored in their signet ring. This gives the vampire the ability to cast one prepared spell they had already previously cast today without spending a spell slot. The vampire must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

HhkalK1aMfqDSiWQ.name: Drink Blood
HhkalK1aMfqDSiWQ.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[10[healing]]{10 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drained value by 1, killing the victim when it reaches drained 5. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

DD9mP7VmHRk4Lm97.name: Steady Spellcasting
DD9mP7VmHRk4Lm97.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt the vampire mastermind's spellcasting action, the vampire attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. If the vampire succeeds, their action isn't disrupted.

zl24K9E3qEAfVXrR.name: Turn to Mist
zl24K9E3qEAfVXrR.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses fast healing while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.

GuozOBpJ0vRt64hK.name: Unimpeded
GuozOBpJ0vRt64hK.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The shadowpact vampire automatically ends one effect that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed.

Shadowpact Stone Bulwark.name: Shadowpact Stone Bulwark
Shadowpact Stone Bulwark.description: Stone bulwarks are slow and steady constructs typically carved from marble or granite. They're often made to serve as works of art when at rest, so some magical crafters employ master sculptors to ensure their constructs make beautiful statues. Older stone bulwarks might be weathered, with scuffed or cracked surfaces or missing noses and digits, but this weathering is largely cosmetic and doesn't adversely impact the bulwark's functionality.

bhmnG9zTS4ncYGoL.name: Statuary Aura
bhmnG9zTS4ncYGoL.description:
20 feet.

Rocks of marble magically arise from the ground in the aura. They protect the bulwark's allies, giving each of them standard @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{Cover}. These stones can be used for Throw Rock.

This aura automatically activates at the start of the stone bulwark's first turn in combat and deactivates at the end of combat.

AQkAJLS7IVqr7GLQ.name: Binding Stone
AQkAJLS7IVqr7GLQ.description: Any creature hit by the stone bulwark's fist or rock Strike is affected by a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind} spell.

bKmTRJI4PjS70sWZ.name: Inexorable March
bKmTRJI4PjS70sWZ.description: The stone bulwark Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34] save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise it is damaged as if hit by the construct's fist.

j0KjQKuc5uvWrFxj.name: Mythic Ferocity
j0KjQKuc5uvWrFxj.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The stone bulwark is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 3}

Trigger The stone bulwark is reduced to 0 HP

Effect The stone bulwark avoids being knocked out and remains at half its maximum HP, but its wounded value increases by 1.

Concentrated Congealed Magic.name: Concentrated Congealed Magic
Concentrated Congealed Magic.description:
Tomb jellies are animate masses of protoplasm with a sickly combination of yellow, gray, and black hues. Their acidic bodies dissolve flesh but leave other materials, including a victim's gear and bones, intact. Some ancient cultures entombed bodies in stone sarcophagi with tomb jellies to allow the ooze to break down the flesh and clean and polish the bones.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

rKZevHCH4PMtuj6Z.name: Motion Sense
rKZevHCH4PMtuj6Z.description: A tomb jelly can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

BzmoXVcXW8cazBe5.name: Bound in Death
BzmoXVcXW8cazBe5.description: The concentrated congealed magic splatters some of its substance on a willing undead creature within its reach. The target regains @Damage[5[healing,void]|shortLabel] HP, and its melee Strikes get the benefits of shadow curse until the end of its next turn.

snySLSbjtHjATjFS.name: Flesh-dissolving Acid
snySLSbjtHjATjFS.description: A tomb jelly's acid damages only flesh.

A872unbEeSXWQvTn.name: Shadow Curse
A872unbEeSXWQvTn.description: A creature hit by concentrated congealed magic's pseudopod takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage. If the creature dies while it has this persistent damage, its corpse is affected by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Peaceful Rest}, except the concentrated congealed magic can still dissolve its flesh.

G9RDOnk58z4e0Mof.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 5)
G9RDOnk58z4e0Mof.description: The automatic greeter has Hardness. Once the automatic greeter is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 15.

blGUawuZyyQVnVXf.name: Pounce
blGUawuZyyQVnVXf.description: The tiger Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the tiger began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

G3Hz9uWIYCEyoBRq.name: Sneak Attack
G3Hz9uWIYCEyoBRq.description: The tiger deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

g51BzhmOH3vHLWup.name: Wrestle
g51BzhmOH3vHLWup.description: The tiger makes a claw Strike against a creature it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbing}. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Mischievous Umberweed.name: Mischievous Umberweed
Mischievous Umberweed.description:
The mischievous dragon sprites called draxies have dueled their pixie cousins for the title of ultimate prankster for centuries. They exercise patience and planning to create the perfect pranks, spending months, or even years, on their efforts. One exception to their flighty nature is the elucrea, a lifelong bond between a draxie and a creature they're particularly fond of, typically one with a good sense of humor. According to draxie legend, a little piece of a draxie's spirit remembers being united as the ancient fey dragonet Elucredassa, and that causes draxies to yearn for such connections with others.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

5eqtzIqWpDscyCIh.name: Draxie Dust
5eqtzIqWpDscyCIh.description:
The draxie breathes magical dust in a @Template[cone|distance:15]. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the effect. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:19] save or be affected.

The draxie can't use Draxie Dust again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Draxie Dust]]{1d4 rounds}.

  1. The target takes the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell.
  2. The target loses its last 5 minutes of memory.
  3. The target takes the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  4. For 1 minute, the target is in a state of euphoria that makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Penumbra (11-12).name: Penumbra (11-12)
Penumbra (11-12).description:
A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster.

To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history-both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.

gakDYFEsPKyFUdIg.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

gSG1OZxFHX2zLrNP.name: Counterspell
gSG1OZxFHX2zLrNP.description:
Trigger A creature casts a spell Penumbra has prepared

Effect Penumbra expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. She loses her spell slot as if she had cast the triggering spell. She then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.

NZ4zu9f5ftZJjtdV.name: Mythic Resilience (Reflex and Will)
NZ4zu9f5ftZJjtdV.description: The creature treats its saving throws with the associated save as one degree of success better than it rolled. This is not cumulative with other effects that change their degree of success, like the incapacitation trait (except for rolling a natural 1 or 20). Each time the monster gains mythic resilience, choose one save. The ability should apply to the creature's highest saves first.

CjdoOLjRkqyfp25v.name: Rejuvenation
CjdoOLjRkqyfp25v.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Lich Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if their soul cage is found and destroyed.

1AASbe0SLKqBO4HV.name: Void Shroud
1AASbe0SLKqBO4HV.description: 30 feet. Penumbra is surrounded by an aura of death, drawing forth souls to be consumed by her constant hunger. Living creatures in the emanation take a –2 status penalty to saves against fear and death effects. In addition, any creature that starts its turn in the area gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} condition unless it succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:34] save.

quPIpHuEPYyKlcx8.name: Condition Removal
quPIpHuEPYyKlcx8.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Penumbra ends one condition currently affecting her.

m6CbK52GoU471gez.name: Drain Soul Cage
m6CbK52GoU471gez.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Penumbra taps into her soul cage's power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest rank the lich can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich's prepared spells. The lich's soul cage doesn't need to be present for the lich to use this ability.

IBX7Tix58PNMLskp.name: Siphon Life
IBX7Tix58PNMLskp.description: A lich's form draws forth life from those who come into contact with it. When the lich damages a living creature with an unarmed attack, the lich gains 5 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a Fortitude save against the lich's spell DC – 2 or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. If Penumbra is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} at the start of its turn, each creature grabbing or restraining it must succeed at a Fortitude save or become drained 1. If the lich siphons a creature's life again, the drained value increase by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

C5y1lJqpBIWJJw33.name: Spell Recharge
C5y1lJqpBIWJJw33.description:
Cost 1 Mythic Point

Effect Penumbra immediately gains an additional use of a spell she has already cast.

5TLoRDxeWBDh6a6e.name: Steady Spellcasting
5TLoRDxeWBDh6a6e.description: If a reaction would disrupt Penumbra's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Fmkei93T69EHT8Zp.name: Face Me!
Fmkei93T69EHT8Zp.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet deals damage to Matriarch Szvetneera

Effect The Ulfen bodyguard lets out a threating bellow at whoever injured their ward. They then attempt a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} against the triggering creature, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to the check.

1eVSfQ2hcf3vsAgD.name: Back Away!
1eVSfQ2hcf3vsAgD.description:
The Ulfen witchguard attacks the target, pushing them back and away from their charge. The witchguard makes a Strike against the creature, then attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} their target. Depending on the outcome of their Strike, there may be additional effects.

Critical Success The Ulfen witchguard gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their attempt to Shove.

Success The Ulfen witchguard gains a +1 circumstance bonus to their attempt to Shove.

Failure There is no effect.

Critical Failure The Ulfen witchguard is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of their next turn.

9tVyGfBUHb3AJZmy.name: Telepathy (100 feet)
9tVyGfBUHb3AJZmy.description: A monster with telepathy can communicate mentally with any creatures within the listed radius, as long as they share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts, and communicates no more information than normal speech would.

prtTIT0LyapARhoz.name: Hope Vulnerability
prtTIT0LyapARhoz.description: The elegecide is fueled by the certainty of doom, which leaves it weakened by any hope. The first time each round that a creature critically fails at an attack or skill check against the elegecide, it experiences a burst of hope that leaves it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

y53eOVRvnut1jdIQ.name: Doom Aura
y53eOVRvnut1jdIQ.description:
30 feet

The elegecide constantly emits telepathic warnings about future dangers and harm. When a non-demon creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

6nmHe20KIytqxeJS.name: Dorsal Lash
6nmHe20KIytqxeJS.description:
The elegecide lashes out with its trailing dorsal fins, looping them around a target within 15 feet. It sends a burst of telepathic information about all the possible ways the target can be injured in the next minute. The target takes @Damage[1d4[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:16|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the elegecide.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the elegecide.

Demonic River Drake.name: Demonic River Drake
Demonic River Drake.description:
Although the glistening scales and sleek, fin-like wings on these drakes give them an appearance reminiscent of river fish, they are actually distant relatives of the dragons that rule the oceans. While smaller than most drakes, river drakes are more than capable of plaguing river travelers and are equally at home above and below the water's surface. This flexibility allows them to catch a wide variety of prey, from fish and boggards to deer and the occasional ferry passenger.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct, drakes are draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of the primal dragons they share evolutionary roots with. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties—small social groups fittingly called "rampages"—makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them with their formidable jaws and thickscaled tails to use in close combat. Most drakes would rather avoid this, however, preferring to use their magical breath to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

Different species of drakes rarely come into conflict. Part of this is their distinct habitats, but drakes are open to negotiating simple agreements between rampages. This courtesy does not extend to dragonets, which drakes happily take as prey. Solitary tamed drakes are also excluded from such agreements and considered free game if their tamer isn't strong enough to protect them.

Drake Eggs

While drake hides aren't any more valuable than those of similarly sized creatures, drake eggs are prized commodities. They are used as components in powerful spells as well as eaten by various cultures, but the most common use for drake eggs is hatching and rearing drakes to serve as mounts and guardians.

A typical drake lays a clutch of 2d4 eggs every 5 years. Eggs hatch within 3 to 6 weeks, during which time they must be kept in conditions appropriate to their natural environment, perhaps the most difficult aspect of drake husbandry. While it is generally easy for breeders to incubate the eggs of desert or jungle drakes (which require mildly warm temperatures to hatch) or river drakes (which must be submerged in running water), the eggs of flame and frost drakes require extreme temperatures in order to hatch, which can be difficult to replicate safely.

A drake egg is an object with Hardness 3, 5 HP, and no Broken Threshold. The coloration of drake eggs varies only slightly from one species to the next. A creature must succeed at a @Check[nature|dc:20] check, or a relevant DC 20 Lore check, to identify the drake species of a specific egg.

Once a drake hatches, they imprint on the first creature that they see. A creature imprinted on in this way can use Nature to Train and Command that drake. The market price of a drake egg varies depending on the type of drake and the exact legal situation. Because drakes are dangerous and intelligent creatures, many societies do not condone the trade of drake eggs and criminalize those who engage in it.

It takes 2 years for a drake hatchling to grow to full size. A well-trained drake can make a fearsome mount or guardian, but many careless would-be drake trainers are devoured by their charges.

jbjsVEFvVsslwVHa.name: Tail Lash
jbjsVEFvVsslwVHa.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the river drake's tail uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check.

Effect The river drake attempts to Strike the triggering creature with its tail. If it hits, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash}

xheziaVMnj1iAjP5.name: Chthonic Mucus
xheziaVMnj1iAjP5.description:
The river drake spits a ball of caustic mucus up to a range of 30 feet that explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:5]. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[3d6[spirit]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save). Those that fail this save also take a –5-foot status penalty to their Speed for 1 round.

The river drake can't use Chthonic Mucus again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Chthonic Mucus]]{1d6 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.campaign-effects.Item.cpeMnTLFpi106fjg]{Effect: Chthonic Mucus (1-2)}

GsSxwd5EPNBqxdWC.name: Draconic Frenzy
GsSxwd5EPNBqxdWC.description: The river drake makes one Fangs Strike and two Tail Strikes in any order.

qugqAWTLubz9fcj2.name: Speed Surge
qugqAWTLubz9fcj2.description:
Frequency three times per day;

Effect The river drake Strides or Flies twice.

Shadowpact Shadow.name: Shadowpact Shadow
Shadowpact Shadow.description:
Shadows that spend long amounts of time on the Netherworld and absorb its magic become greater shadows.

The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light.

kppTcx5TylWkpfF1.name: Light Vulnerability
kppTcx5TylWkpfF1.description: Attacks against the shadow are treated as magical if made by a creature who is in magical light or with an object that is in magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell).

6PZpeNlYGVEoZJmo.name: Deadly Striker
6PZpeNlYGVEoZJmo.description: The shadowpact shadow deals an additional 1d6 precision damage on their next Strike whenever they use an action to Stride 10 or more feet.

zadQdUq4eeiDSHSq.name: Greater Shadow Spawn
zadQdUq4eeiDSHSq.description: When a creature's shadow is pulled free by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} Shadow, it becomes a greater shadow spawn under the command of the shadow that created it, using these statistics without Deadly Striker, Steal Shadow, or Unimpeded. This shadow spawn is incurably @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous greater shadow, gaining Steal Shadow and losing the clumsy condition. If the creature recovers from its enfeeblement, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.

VB81WcGgMngyyh3E.name: Slink in Shadows
VB81WcGgMngyyh3E.description: The shadow can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

sslSR9PEr8cWdVop.name: Steal Shadow
sslSR9PEr8cWdVop.description:
Requirements The shadow hit a living creature with a shadow hand Strike on its previous action

Effect The shadow pulls at the target's shadow, making the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} on a critical hit). This is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from shadows, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}. If this increases a creature's enfeebled value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is separated from its body (see shadow spawn). The enfeebled value from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} Shadow decreases by 1 every hour.

c9FbrbyXGCZAqGN8.name: Unimpeded
c9FbrbyXGCZAqGN8.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The shadowpact shadow automatically ends one effect that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed.

YQi4pEcsJfon1nS3.name: Cybernetics
YQi4pEcsJfon1nS3.description: The cybernetics of a cybernetic zombie can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful [[/act disable-device dc=19]] check. A zombie's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A cybernetic zombie with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions (including self-destruct).

VTtnqCB7pHtTrVJJ.name: Self Destruct
VTtnqCB7pHtTrVJJ.description:
A cybernetic zombie must use this reaction unless its cybernetics are disabled

Trigger The cybernetic zombie is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The zombie's damaged cybernetics explode, dealing @Damage[(3d8+2)[electricity]] damage in a @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10-foot radius} (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save). This ability destroys any technological items on the zombie.

Dread Zombie Leshy Horde.name: Dread Zombie Leshy Horde
Dread Zombie Leshy Horde.description:
This shuffling mass of decaying flesh moves with dull but singular focus.

Necromancers most often create these mindless undead as obedient, expendable servitors. Left to its own devices, a zombie seeks only to consume the living, stopping only when its rotting body can no longer hold together.

yQzN4wExqO58Ssdr.name: Slow
yQzN4wExqO58Ssdr.description: A zombie leshy horde is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions

xb36ZcB5nu2McDrU.name: Grave Tide
xb36ZcB5nu2McDrU.description: The zombie leshy horde is less organized than most troops. It can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into its spaces. Its spaces are difficult terrain to other creatures.

YNpN5FwvZ27Zfviz.name: Shambling Onslaught
YNpN5FwvZ27Zfviz.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The leshy zombies lash out at any enemies in their squares or within 5 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d12+5)[bludgeoning]] damage

2 @Damage[(1d12+10)[bludgeoning]] damage

ck37LN0pcQmPLf0a.name: Troop Movement
ck37LN0pcQmPLf0a.description: Whenever a troop Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

cgTJQzySanVtWglT.name: Brimstone Defense
cgTJQzySanVtWglT.description:
Trigger The Chelaxian mage takes fire damage

Effect The Chelaxian mage gains resistance 6 to fire against the triggering attack. If this damage came from an unarmed attack, a non-reach melee weapon, or a spell with a range of touch, the creature who caused the damage takes @Damage[6[fire]] damage.

vTRZSJ3M3RSOpMCo.name: Brimstone Blessing
vTRZSJ3M3RSOpMCo.description:
Requirements The Chelaxian mage's last action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect The Chelaxian mage siphons devilish energy drawn from pacts with a vordine devil into their trident. Until the end of the turn, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 fire damage, gains the unholy trait, and gains the effects of a returning rune.

ESDBq0xFsFgtElmi.name: Devil Summoning
ESDBq0xFsFgtElmi.description: The Chelaxian mage can cast a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.29ytKctjg7qSW2ff]{Summon Fiend} arcane spell to summon a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.qvagIV8gqF0g3m3l]{Vordine} devil. To do so, they must sacrifice three 3rd-rank prepared spells and voluntarily take @Damage[4d12[fire]] damage that can't be reduced or prevented. If the Chelaxian mage is unable to Sustain the Spell, including if they're knocked out or killed, the spell continues, but the GM rolls a @Check[flat|dc:10] each round, ending the spell on a failure; regardless of whether the spell continues or not, the vordine devil attacks whatever creature is closest to it indiscriminately. If the Chelaxian mage dies, the devil disappears.

Weak Xurgimoth.name: Weak Xurgimoth
Weak Xurgimoth.description:
The magic that flows through primal dragons can manifest more animalistic or bestial features in a given type of dragon. Notably among these are the massive paired horns of the horned dragon. While their bulky frames, natural coloration, and prominent ridged scales are all remarkable in their own way, it's the horns that are most obvious and striking at first glance. Horned dragons use their horns to impale their prey in a quick and brutal display of their might. They are generally contemplative and have a fixation on knowledge and self-discipline, traits belied by their bestial appearance. As a result, horned dragons are generally more open to speaking with outsiders.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

ItyDWQiPz0eJ2hOb.name: Twisting Tail
ItyDWQiPz0eJ2hOb.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the dragon disrupts the creature's action.

Iv8LMCTGw5NLD5aD.name: Draconic Frenzy
Iv8LMCTGw5NLD5aD.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.

XhU4mCNUkX4dqLS7.name: Draconic Momentum
