Effect The Chelaxian weaponmaster twists their blade and pushes with their shield to create an opening in the required opponent's defenses. That opponent takes a –2 status penalty to their AC against the next Strike made against them before the start of the Chelaxian weaponmaster's next turn. While this penalty lasts, the Chelaxian weaponmaster gains an additional reaction they can only use to make a Reactive Strike against the penalized opponent.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.IPfr5O7bTwJhRB5v]{Effect: Create Opening}

XT0y11wxiGBpVoRU.name: Do You Know Who I Am?!
XT0y11wxiGBpVoRU.description:
Frequency 1/day.

The Chelaxian adjutant shouts at all present. The adjutant makes an @Check[intimidation|defense:will] check and compares it to the Will DCs of all enemies within 30 feet. On a success, that foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. A critical success does not grant an additional effect.

SxuBKaPlLJ3ubWSe.name: Selfish Shield
SxuBKaPlLJ3ubWSe.description:
Trigger An enemy in this creature's champion's aura damages them

Effect This creature gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, regardless of damage type. In addition, their Strikes against the triggering creature deal 1 extra spirit damage until the end of their next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.h6nyMp4dtPXBfCJc]{Effect: Selfish Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.2a6fuugiPpICe3Li]{Effect: Champion's Extra Damage}

wC0EwJj78CkYhtvL.name: Powerful Faith
wC0EwJj78CkYhtvL.description: When the champion of Deskari critically succeeds at a Strike against an enemy with their scythe, their enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and moved 5 feet in the direction of the champion's choice. This is forced movement.

8yj4qvRSHNMZp5kI.name: Flutter
8yj4qvRSHNMZp5kI.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The paper mite flies up to its speed, and then enters the space of a hostile creature, flitting about its face. The target must make a @Check[reflex|dc:16] save. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round (dazzled for 1 minute on a critical failure).

1CUi9QEspSFb6L9m.name: Hellish Spellstrike
1CUi9QEspSFb6L9m.description: Yollen's signature spellstrike channels the ill will of Hell. He casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6DfLZBl8wKIV03Iq]{Ignition}, then makes a melee attack strike with his greataxe. If he successfully hits, he deals an additional 2d6 damage (4d6 on a critical hit) on top of the damage from ignition and the greataxe. This counts as two attacks for the purposes of multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not apply until after Yollen completes this ability. Yollen cannot use Hellish Spellstrike again until he has recharge it using a single action with the concentrate trait or cast his conflux spell.

hzoFSN3ShYWPgJjG.name: Mountain of Iron
hzoFSN3ShYWPgJjG.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect Yollen draws upon the power of the warshard to bolster his health. He gains fast healing 5 for 1 minute.

Tough Puddles Ghoul.name: Tough Puddles Ghoul
Tough Puddles Ghoul.description:
Ghouls stalkers are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

nwmDJVsxF9KS0Ji9.name: Slurp Blood
nwmDJVsxF9KS0Ji9.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the tough Puddles ghoul's reach

Effect The ghoul bites the creature, slurping its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the target's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim takes @Damage[(1d8+3)[piercing]] damage and the tough Puddles ghoul regains @Damage[4[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary HP.

Ycy1nGPHEsariBcE.name: Swift Movement
Ycy1nGPHEsariBcE.description: The Puddles ghoul jumps up to half its Speed or swims up to half its swim Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

qWNxjCGkNzFWuJsx.name: Consume Flesh
qWNxjCGkNzFWuJsx.description: Averill devours his raw fish and regains @Damage[3d6[healing]] Hit Points.

VevwO6BlBLu9jVZA.name: Grave Tidings
VevwO6BlBLu9jVZA.description:
Requirement A grabbed, paralyzed, restrained, or unconscious creature is within Averill's reach

Effect Averill whispers into the creature's ears, compelling them to join him. The creature is unable to attack Averill Quint for the duration, unless Averill uses a hostile action against them, and any undead Pathfinder can treat the creature as an ally for purposes of flanking. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The curse lasts 1 round.

Critical Failure The curse lasts 2 rounds.

Q5Qd599tQTMtgOYk.name: Swift Stroke
Q5Qd599tQTMtgOYk.description: Averill swims up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

9PyQKrYhwwi2TOSM.name: Averill's Orders
9PyQKrYhwwi2TOSM.description:
Frequency once per round;

Effect Averill orders an ally to attack or to get in position. The ally can immediately Strike or move up to half its swim Speed. If it moves, the movement does not trigger reactions.

1lMfclHhDDu7nudH.name: Repair Nanites (Fast Healing 7)
1lMfclHhDDu7nudH.description: The brain guzzler has integrated nanites that swarm over damage, healing it.

VGtxQgR50RgNXgLv.name: Cybernetics
VGtxQgR50RgNXgLv.description: The cybernetics of a brain guzzler can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful [[/act disable-device dc=22]] check. A brain guzzler's cybernetics are disabled for 1 hour if it takes any electricity damage. A brain guzzler with disabled cybernetics is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Ww1mMdRu5yJSpaYj.name: Guzzle
Ww1mMdRu5yJSpaYj.description:
Trigger The brain guzzler kills an enemy

Effect The brain guzzler breaks open its victim's skull and eats the brain. The brain guzzler gains knowledge of the victim's memories, and its Intelligence increases by +1. The victim can no longer be raised from the dead by any method that requires an intact corpse and rises as a zombie shambler the next day at dawn.

YWzEkwp5ZbNl5zmJ.name: Ulna Bow
YWzEkwp5ZbNl5zmJ.description: The brain guzzler fires with the ulna bow, which rips the ulna out of its own forearm and fires it at one target within 120 feet. The target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:25] save or take @Damage[(3d8+5)[piercing]] damage. The ulna explodes on impact, dealing @Damage[4d8[piercing]] damage to adjacent creatures (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). Once the ulna bow has been used once it can't be used again.

Shard-Empowered Levaloch.name: Shard-Empowered Levaloch
Shard-Empowered Levaloch.description:
Fearsome giants of jagged iron, levalochs serve in the armies of Hell as potent warriors and tenacious hunters-creatures of absolute discipline endlessly obedient to diabolical tyrants.

There are countless legions of lawful fiends in the nine layers of Hell, warring against the celestial planes and scouring the Material Plane for souls to corrupt.

cQMEu0nbq6cPn2sD.name: Hellstrider
cQMEu0nbq6cPn2sD.description:
A levaloch ignores the effects of non-magical difficult terrain. They take no damage from caltrops or from damaging terrain that deals physical, acid, or cold damage.

A levaloch can move through liquids up to 5 feet deep at their full Speed.

dW7bkWhXvNcwfUCh.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

u3ndMdQRfiAH7Z7J.name: Phalanx Fighter
u3ndMdQRfiAH7Z7J.description:
All devils of equal or lower level adjacent to a levaloch gain a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC as the levaloch shields them from harm.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.KjWPSJonzrZ8jv7X]{Effect: Phalanx Fighter}

rXrJgVzgOwMP7Cbr.name: Stable Stance
rXrJgVzgOwMP7Cbr.description: A levaloch gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Fortitude DC against being Shoved and to other saving throws to resist being moved against their will.

T6ZAqc1mMzmpUCtm.name: Barbed Net
T6ZAqc1mMzmpUCtm.description:
When a levaloch hits a creature with their barbed net, the net wraps around the target, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. If the Strike was a critical success, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}.

When a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 22), or if the Strike misses, the net crumbles into rust.

Each time a creature attempts to Escape, it takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage from the net's barbs, regardless of whether the attempt succeeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HafP5vrdGdoqoFMo]{Effect: Barbed Net}

X5bjxwBhWpEDkFUA.name: Forge Warshard Weapon
X5bjxwBhWpEDkFUA.description: A levaloch recalls their warshard-infused iron back to create a new +1 striking trident or barbed net. A creatures on the line between the weapon and the levaloch must make a basic @Check[reflex|dc:23] save against @Damage[7d8[piercing]] damage. The levaloch's previous trident crumbles to rust. When the levaloch is destroyed, any tridents or barbed nets they created crumble to rust.

sX0MwC23Mvp1YeD2.name: Merciless Thrust
sX0MwC23Mvp1YeD2.description: When a levaloch hits a creature that has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} conditions with a melee trident Strike, the Strike deals an additional [[/r 2d6]] damage.

Decked-Out Appraiser.name: Decked-Out Appraiser
Decked-Out Appraiser.description:
Neither human nor beast yet resembling both, yeongno (yeong-no) are creatures that once were denizens of heaven but were cast out, down to the mortal Universe, due to their own greed. Yeongno claim to have once been celestial dragons and wear elongated dragon masks with full-body wraps decorated with scale patterns in honor of this claim—though no one has been able to confirm the veracity of this belief. As they wander, they hold a willow pipe in their mouths, producing a distinct "bibi" sound that often heralds their appearance.

Despite their reputation as monsters who eat people, yeongno are welcomed by the poor and oppressed, who see the creatures as wise and just. Yeongno believe that by eating 100 wealthy individuals who abuse their wealth or who accumulated their wealth by underhanded or exploitative means, they can atone for their own greed, allowing them to ascend back into heaven. A corrupt and greedy individual can escape their fate of being eaten by a yeongno by giving away all of their wealth and agreeing to be transformed into a pig for one year. If the person can endure one year living as a pig in the care of a household they once harmed, the yeongno will spare them.

nHkmmECcNb37nfCM.name: Goldsense (Precise) 120 feet
nHkmmECcNb37nfCM.description: The yeongno can detect the presence, location, and approximate value of gold within 120 feet.

6eug6ysw8yCw92jm.name: Fortune's Favor
6eug6ysw8yCw92jm.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect A target creature within 30 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or gain the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis}, being polymorphed into a pig whose girth is determined by the target's wealth. After 24 hours, the target can end this effect using a Dismiss action, at which point the yeongno becomes aware that the effect has ended. A yeongno can use Fortune's Favor only if no targets are currently under its effects.

pO7jeDvpQCsZJiE4.name: Money is Pain
pO7jeDvpQCsZJiE4.description:
Requirements The target is carrying at least 100 gp worth of precious metals

Effect The yeongno crushes a creature it can see with the weight of their wealth. Apparitions of gold coins approximating the wealth of the target materialize and pummel the target from all sides. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:28] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target takes @Damage[3d8[persistent,mental]] damage and is slowed 1 as long as the damage continues. The effect immediately ends if they're carrying less than 100 gp worth of precious metals.

Critical Failure As failure, except any flat checks to remove the persistent damage automatically fail.

Whippoorwill Pathfinder Protector.name: Whippoorwill Pathfinder Protector
Whippoorwill Pathfinder Protector.description:
Ghouls stalkers are ravenous undead who haunt graveyards and eat corpses.

Few creatures are more ubiquitous to sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts than the flesh-eating undead known as ghouls.

7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.name: Consume Flesh
7RTjFlVzsxhjtwX4.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

jShRo5PDthe4aFDT.name: Ghoul Whispers
jShRo5PDthe4aFDT.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature is within the ghoul's reach

Effect The ghoul whispers dark thoughts and vile cravings into the creature's ears. The creature must save against the forbidden cravings curse.

Forbidden Cravings (curse)

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:15|traits:curse]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effects (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} until it consumes raw meat (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2

Stage 4 as stage 2 unless the target has consumed raw meat in the past 24 hours, then it takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} until it consumes raw meat;

Stage 5 if the creature has eaten raw meat in the past 24 hours, it dies and rises as a ghoul, if not, it returns to stage 4

rvraBop9oOSwcjkq.name: Swift Stroke
rvraBop9oOSwcjkq.description: The ghoul swims up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Weak Gluttonous Geode.name: Weak Gluttonous Geode
Weak Gluttonous Geode.description:
The vast ranks of earth elementals have been slow to respond to the return of the elemental lords and the Planes of Metal and Wood. These events have not broken the mountains, nor have they blown away the sands.

Earthy Emotions

Earth elementals talk even less than most elementals. They're ponderous, weighing decisions so slowly they can crush the energy from a discussion. Their foremost concern is whether a situation can be endured. Though a rare or resplendent treasure might entice an earth elemental, it's difficult to spur any sense of urgency in them without the presence of an immediate threat.

iiNeC7jyAcDS6aGh.name: Attach
iiNeC7jyAcDS6aGh.description: The geode Leaps up to 15 feet and makes a crystal teeth Strike. If it hits a creature larger than itself, it can attach to that creature. Doing so is like Grabbing the creature (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 15), but the geode moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. The geode is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while attached. If the geode is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature, that creature takes @Damage[1[bleed]]{1 persistent bleed} damage. Escaping the attached geode or removing the geode in other ways doesn't cause bleed damage.

JQEFb9KA6XUO7dyb.name: Gnaw
JQEFb9KA6XUO7dyb.description:
Requirements The geode is attached to a creature

Effect The geode deals @Damage[1d4[bludgeoning]] damage to the creature it's attached to (@Check[fortitude|dc:15|basic] save).

blGUawuZyyQVnVXf.name: Pounce
blGUawuZyyQVnVXf.description: The tiger Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the tiger began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

G3Hz9uWIYCEyoBRq.name: Sneak Attack
G3Hz9uWIYCEyoBRq.description: The tiger deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

g51BzhmOH3vHLWup.name: Wrestle
g51BzhmOH3vHLWup.description: The tiger makes a claw Strike against a creature it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbing}. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Weak Wood Scamp.name: Weak Wood Scamp
Weak Wood Scamp.description:
These moss colonies coalesce over a century into the rough facsimile of a large sloth, right down to mimicking the unique structure of the animal's fur that attracts additional fungi and pollinating insects. Unless summoned or attacked, they rarely leave the trees upon which they first formed.

At first glance, wood elementals might not seem to have the same destructive potential as their cousins from the Planes of Fire, Water, or Air, but don't be fooled. The woods can be a dangerous place.

Though some resemble animals, the elemental beasts presented here are still plants, and their life cycles reflect it. Vegetable lambs grow on rooted stalks, from which they can't be removed until they've matured (or perhaps ripened), leaving them dependent on their immediate surroundings for food. Moss sloths are little more than lumps of green fluff for the first century of their existence, only gaining limited mobility once they can grow their defensive wooden claws.

Wild But Unwild

Many wood elementals are created by kizidhars and other powerful creatures on the Plane of Wood and placed in rote roles. Populating nature preserves and sprawling estates, they can be unsure how to behave if released into the wild. They're essentially born domesticated and will likely act far differently than the wild creatures they mimic, even in natural environments. Their natural predators are few, putting the elementals at less risk, although they're still sometimes eaten by giant termites or captured by some as pets.

A Brain By Any Other Name

Even if Lady Shumunue taught the wood elementals' ancestors to mimic animals, a wood elemental's consciousness is contained not in a brain but in its root system. Entities like nursery crawlers, living groves, and carved beasts use this to their advantage. That an elemental's wooden body can be carved and crafted, apparently without lasting harm, implies that they might not feel pain so long as their roots remain undamaged.

OkAkqlgDi1isALeF.name: Breathe Pollen
OkAkqlgDi1isALeF.description: The wood scamp breathes choking pollen in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[(2d6-4)[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic|options:area-effect] save; creatures who don't need to breathe are immune). The wood scamp can't Breathe Pollen again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Pollen]]{1d4 rounds}.

cDhKXGyP6SctggAU.name: Thorn Puncture
cDhKXGyP6SctggAU.description: The wood scamp breaks off one of its thorn-like claws in the target's skin, dealing 1 persistent bleed damage until the thorn is removed, which requires an Interact action. This damage is cumulative with each thorn caught in a creature's skin.

Elite Air Scamp.name: Elite Air Scamp
Elite Air Scamp.description:
A pale blue head and paper-thin wings peek out from the cloud that clings to the air scamp. Air scamps are short-sighted and flighty, even relative to their kin; they are as likely to fly recklessly into battle as they are to whine in terror at a loud noise.

Elemental scamps are bat-like critters marked by elemental powers. Scamps are dispatched from the Elemental Planes by more powerful residents or called to the Universe by neophyte summoners. All scamps have a hint of magical power due to a lingering connection to their home plane, which they largely use to pull simple pranks.

Scamps rapidly form a pecking order of cleverness. Humanoids often confuse scamps when meeting such creatures for the first time. These confused scamps usually resort to an escalating series of pranks and mischief, seeing what they can get away with to establish their place in the hierarchy.

1CENtBTrhih9EKVU.name: Fog Vision
1CENtBTrhih9EKVU.description: The air scamp ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from fog and mist.

yC1vWH3Q9V6GoICd.name: Sirocco Breath
yC1vWH3Q9V6GoICd.description:
The air scamp creates cutting winds in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deal @Damage[(2d6+4)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails its save is also pushed back 10 feet.

The air scamp can't use Sirocco Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sirocco Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

OCYtPsv3fWOckHQM.name: Bloodscent
OCYtPsv3fWOckHQM.description: When Searching or Seeking for creatures who have taken piercing or slashing damage in the last 24 hours, the wild dog's sense of smell is precise.

mdX3CwGRpvkhQnKY.name: Gnash
mdX3CwGRpvkhQnKY.description:
Requirements The wild dog's last action was a successful jaws Strike

Effect The wild dog gnashes its teeth to deal a particularly vicious wound; the Strike's target takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

x9O6fmeWhRcwsGEd.name: Pack Attack
x9O6fmeWhRcwsGEd.description: The wild dog's Strikes deal 1d6 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wild dog's allies.

6jIvPGI89DjHhbbB.name: Constrict Mind
6jIvPGI89DjHhbbB.description: The manifestation of nightmare deals @Damage[(2d6+9)[mental]] damage to any number of creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by it (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure.

G2oXTAPyRAALRTFA.name: Morphic Limb
G2oXTAPyRAALRTFA.description: A manifestation of nightmare can form up to 8 morphic limbs at the same time. These limbs are constantly shifting their features according to the manifestation's whims, becoming fists, claws, pincers, blades, and anything else that it can imagine.

RwOpOaB417q5eIKE.name: Recurring Nightmare
RwOpOaB417q5eIKE.description: A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creature that is being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by a manifestation of nightmare can't reduce the value of its frightened condition below 1 until it Escapes.

IT0KNDfWpGkEg7VM.name: Unnerving Echo
IT0KNDfWpGkEg7VM.description: If the manifestation of nightmare critically hits with a nightmare vision Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

PLheo8kLE84kRJDr.name: Unholy Rebuke
PLheo8kLE84kRJDr.description:
Trigger The Chelaxian cleric takes damage from a melee attack

Effect The Chelaxian cleric promises unholy retribution upon the attacker and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature.

nr8JopVzew1Inp8F.name: Divine Weapon
nr8JopVzew1Inp8F.description:
Frequency once per turn

Trigger The Chelaxian cleric finishes Casting a Spell using one of their divine spell slots

Effect Until the end of their turn, the Chelaxian cleric's Strikes gain the unholy trait and deal an additional 1d4 spirit damage; this damage increases to 2d4 against creatures with the holy trait.

Demonbred Bottlenose Dolphin.name: Demonbred Bottlenose Dolphin
Demonbred Bottlenose Dolphin.description:
The bottlenose dolphin is the most common and widespread species of dolphin. They are social predators who hunt shallow seas and rivers in large family groups called pods. Sailors are fond of bottlenose dolphins and frequently tell of how they've saved drowning mariners or protected crew from sharks with blows from their powerful snouts.

Dolphins encompass a wide range of aquatic mammals, all of which are social, intelligent, and widespread throughout the world's oceans.

TBp1tYUPtYoOEonO.name: Aquatic Echolocation 120 feet
TBp1tYUPtYoOEonO.description: A bottlenose dolphin can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

khgGPSxgTQcgev3o.name: Deep Breath
khgGPSxgTQcgev3o.description: A bottlenose dolphin can hold its breath for 2 hours.

jN9qLXiQfaOBlFfC.name: Ramming Speed
jN9qLXiQfaOBlFfC.description:
The bottlenose dolphin @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swims} twice and then makes a snout Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

A Large or smaller creature hit by this attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

PLheo8kLE84kRJDr.name: Unholy Rebuke
PLheo8kLE84kRJDr.description:
Trigger The Chelaxian hierophant takes damage from a melee attack

Effect The Chelaxian hierophant promises unholy retribution upon the attacker and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature.

nr8JopVzew1Inp8F.name: Divine Weapon
nr8JopVzew1Inp8F.description:
Frequency once per turn

Trigger The Chelaxian hierophant finishes Casting a Spell using one of their divine spell slots

Effect Until the end of their turn, the Chelaxian hierophant's Strikes gain the unholy trait and deal an additional 1d4 spirit damage; this damage increases to 2d4 against creatures with the holy trait.

Adolescent Kirin.name: Adolescent Kirin
Adolescent Kirin.description:
Symbols of grace and purity, unicorns resemble proud and noble horses. They typically have pure white coats, but they are best known for the single, delicate horn that extends from the center of their forehead. While unicorns often serve as protectors of unspoiled wilderness and sacred places, they are themselves highly sought after for their horns, which are said to possess potent magical properties. To many, the mere idea of hunting such a magnificent creature in the hopes of severing its horn is utterly reprehensible. Indeed, a dehorned unicorn is a sorry sight, and few such unicorns survive much longer in the wild.

Unicorns are found almost exclusively in remote, unsullied areas of wilderness. Sometimes associated with good-aligned deities, other times associated with nature and the fey, unicorns are always known for their righteousness and nobility. They are wary, at best, of most humanoid creatures, due in large part to poachers' tendency to hunt them for their horns, but unicorns are often rumored to have a weakness for those who are pure of both heart and spirit. Despite some tales, unicorns are equally likely to recognize purity in people of all genders.

QL3594a7048GPCem.name: Animal Empathy
QL3594a7048GPCem.description: The kirin has a connection to the creatures of the natural world that allows them to communicate with animals. They can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.

vNaUr8lkk7o1zXWJ.name: Ghost Touch
vNaUr8lkk7o1zXWJ.description: A kirin's Strikes have the effects of a ghost touch property rune.

65E6IqqYN0IW2HsH.name: Powerful Charge
65E6IqqYN0IW2HsH.description: The kirin Strides up to double its Speed in a straight line and then makes a horn Strike. If the kirin moved at least 20 feet, it deals an additional @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage on a hit.

Elite Concentrated Congealed Magic.name: Elite Concentrated Congealed Magic
Elite Concentrated Congealed Magic.description:
Tomb jellies are animate masses of protoplasm with a sickly combination of yellow, gray, and black hues. Their acidic bodies dissolve flesh but leave other materials, including a victim's gear and bones, intact. Some ancient cultures entombed bodies in stone sarcophagi with tomb jellies to allow the ooze to break down the flesh and clean and polish the bones.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

rKZevHCH4PMtuj6Z.name: Motion Sense
rKZevHCH4PMtuj6Z.description: A tomb jelly can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

BzmoXVcXW8cazBe5.name: Bound in Death
BzmoXVcXW8cazBe5.description: The concentrated congealed magic splatters some of its substance on a willing undead creature within its reach. The target regains @Damage[3[healing,void]|shortLabel] HP, and its melee Strikes get the benefits of shadow curse until the end of its next turn.

snySLSbjtHjATjFS.name: Flesh-dissolving Acid
snySLSbjtHjATjFS.description: A tomb jelly's acid damages only flesh.

A872unbEeSXWQvTn.name: Shadow Curse
A872unbEeSXWQvTn.description: A creature hit by concentrated congealed magic's pseudopod takes @Damage[(1d6-2)[persistent,void]] damage. If the creature dies while it has this persistent damage, its corpse is affected by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Peaceful Rest}, except the concentrated congealed magic can still dissolve its flesh.

6jIvPGI89DjHhbbB.name: Constrict Mind
6jIvPGI89DjHhbbB.description: The manifestation of nightmare deals @Damage[(2d6+6)[mental]] damage to any number of creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by it (@Check[will|dc:25|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure.

G2oXTAPyRAALRTFA.name: Morphic Limb
G2oXTAPyRAALRTFA.description: A manifestation of nightmare can form up to 8 morphic limbs at the same time. These limbs are constantly shifting their features according to the manifestation's whims, becoming fists, claws, pincers, blades, and anything else that it can imagine.

RwOpOaB417q5eIKE.name: Recurring Nightmare
RwOpOaB417q5eIKE.description: A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creature that is being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by a manifestation of nightmare can't reduce the value of its frightened condition below 1 until it Escapes.

IT0KNDfWpGkEg7VM.name: Unnerving Echo
IT0KNDfWpGkEg7VM.description: If the manifestation of nightmare critically hits with a nightmare vision Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Pathfinder Defender.name: Pathfinder Defender
Pathfinder Defender.description:
Shadows that spend long amounts of time on the Netherworld and absorb its magic become greater shadows.

The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light.

kppTcx5TylWkpfF1.name: Light Vulnerability
kppTcx5TylWkpfF1.description: Attacks against the Pathfinder defender are treated as magical if made by a creature who is in magical light or with an object that is in magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell).

zadQdUq4eeiDSHSq.name: Shadow Spawn
zadQdUq4eeiDSHSq.description: When a creature's shadow is pulled free by Steal Shadow, it becomes a shadow spawn under the command of the shadow that created it. This @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.clzHAfegb9Rn6DOe]{Shadow Spawn} doesn't have Steal Shadow. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous shadow. If the creature recovers from its enfeeblement, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.

VB81WcGgMngyyh3E.name: Slink in Shadows
VB81WcGgMngyyh3E.description: The Pathfinder defender can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

sslSR9PEr8cWdVop.name: Steal Shadow
sslSR9PEr8cWdVop.description:
Requirements The Pathfinder defender hit a living creature with a shadow hand Strike on its previous action

Effect The defender pulls at the target's shadow, making the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} on a critical hit). This is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from shadows, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}. If this increases a creature's enfeebled value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is separated from its body (see shadow spawn). The enfeebled value from Steal Shadow decreases by 1 every hour.

3kzVpiCNnEO5HFe1.name: Winter's Bite
3kzVpiCNnEO5HFe1.description:
30 feet, @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save. Hostile creatures within this aura gain weakness 3 to cold. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.AxdLeZcz2VVdfvRo]{Effect: Winter's Bite}

CGcV9WktSMSuX1m5.name: Icy Protection
CGcV9WktSMSuX1m5.description:
Whenever Szvetneera Casts a Spell with the cold trait, she can choose to grant one of her bodyguards resistance to cold 3 until the beginning of Szvetneera's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.MwKc08dMPAFlAwrw]{Effect: Icy Protection}

XcH3Td3YLnfdNhHT.name: Shackling Cold
XcH3Td3YLnfdNhHT.description:
Matriarch Szvetneera uses her mastery of ice magic to hobble a target. If her next action is to Cast a Spell with the cold trait, that spell also gives the target a –10 circumstance penalty to their Speed until the beginning of Szvetneera's next turn if they are affected.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.josVmrDMWcTinHFK]{Effect: Shackling Cold}

Weak Air Scamp.name: Weak Air Scamp
Weak Air Scamp.description:
A pale blue head and paper-thin wings peek out from the cloud that clings to the air scamp. Air scamps are short-sighted and flighty, even relative to their kin; they are as likely to fly recklessly into battle as they are to whine in terror at a loud noise.

Elemental scamps are bat-like critters marked by elemental powers. Scamps are dispatched from the Elemental Planes by more powerful residents or called to the Universe by neophyte summoners. All scamps have a hint of magical power due to a lingering connection to their home plane, which they largely use to pull simple pranks.

Scamps rapidly form a pecking order of cleverness. Humanoids often confuse scamps when meeting such creatures for the first time. These confused scamps usually resort to an escalating series of pranks and mischief, seeing what they can get away with to establish their place in the hierarchy.

1CENtBTrhih9EKVU.name: Fog Vision
1CENtBTrhih9EKVU.description: The air scamp ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from fog and mist.

yC1vWH3Q9V6GoICd.name: Sirocco Breath
yC1vWH3Q9V6GoICd.description:
The air scamp creates cutting winds in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deal @Damage[(2d6-4)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails its save is also pushed back 10 feet.

The air scamp can't use Sirocco Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sirocco Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Shard-Empowered Vordine.name: Shard-Empowered Vordine
Shard-Empowered Vordine.description:
The vast city of Dis trains endless legions of vordines to guard the upper layers of Hell and march across the planes at the archdevils' orders. Although quick to bend their knees to higher-ranking devils and even mortals favored by Asmodeus, vordines are relentlessly cruel to orts and other devils they can call their subordinates.

Although higher ranks in the infernal military are held by more powerful devils, like the nessari who serve as generals, a labyrinthine structure gives each vordine a rank and certain responsibilities. Some vordines are responsible for the battlefield command of squads, while others relay orders from above or are set to handling specific administrative tasks for their unit. The greatest gift one can offer a vordine is an increased rank to lord over other vordines.

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks.

Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly orts perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as infantry and contract devils, while the greatest nessaris command entire infernal armies.

Asmodeus stands at the apex of the structure he created, but the layers below him are marked by a constant jockeying for position. Most diabolic plans ultimately serve to improve the schemer's place in the hierarchy.

pPlbZeWmu7cXNcGS.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

1FRWXS0j3BI8ETs7.name: Reactive Shield Arm
1FRWXS0j3BI8ETs7.description:
Trigger A creature successfully Strikes the vordine

Effect The vordine immediately grows a warshard shield out of its arm, gaining +2 AC against the triggering Strike. This shield then functions as a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4k99nOJudmeNnBTF]{Shielded Arm} spell would.

htudWd2S9lUKBAuJ.name: Burning Hoofprints
htudWd2S9lUKBAuJ.description: The vordine Strides, trailing hoofprints in each square they exit. The hoofprints burn for 1 minute. A creature on the ground that enters a square with burning hoofprints or begins its turn in one takes @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage.

x38RhSkJxk1CkeQZ.name: Trident of Dis
x38RhSkJxk1CkeQZ.description: The vordine makes a trident Strike, increasing their reach to 10 feet for that Strike. If there is an unholy ally between the vordine and their target, that creature's energy causes the Strike to deal an additional 1d6 spirit damage.

6Qu68Hmw1P67f6XV.name: Warshard Healing
6Qu68Hmw1P67f6XV.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The vordine draws upon the power of the warshard to bolster its health. It gains fast healing 5 for 1 minute.

Igrx0lF2yf3PIAaH.name: Abandonment Vulnerability
Igrx0lF2yf3PIAaH.description: A getidline holds on to relationships and refuses to let go. When a creature grabbed by it loses the grabbed condition, the getidline takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage.

L9CuAb7QPpoTtRTt.name: Gripping Aura
L9CuAb7QPpoTtRTt.description:
15 feet.

A getidline subtly influences all living creatures within its aura to focus their attentions on holding to things they care about above all other concerns. When a living, non-demon creature starts its turn in the getidline's aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. On a failure, the targeted is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} as it focuses on maintaining its grip on its weapons and gear (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure). The elementals are immune to this aura as they don't have possessions.

1u7j67eihiSQSeJs.name: Rip Away
1u7j67eihiSQSeJs.description: The getidline rushes forward and rips a creature away from its standing. It Strides, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapples} a creature. If it successfully Grapples, it then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]{Constricts} the creature.

Demonic Ocean Drake.name: Demonic Ocean Drake
Demonic Ocean Drake.description:
Although the glistening scales and sleek, fin-like wings on these drakes give them an appearance reminiscent of river fish, they are actually distant relatives of the dragons that rule the oceans. While smaller than most drakes, river drakes are more than capable of plaguing river travelers and are equally at home above and below the water's surface. This flexibility allows them to catch a wide variety of prey, from fish and boggards to deer and the occasional ferry passenger.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct, drakes are draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of the primal dragons they share evolutionary roots with. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties—small social groups fittingly called "rampages"—makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them with their formidable jaws and thickscaled tails to use in close combat. Most drakes would rather avoid this, however, preferring to use their magical breath to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

Different species of drakes rarely come into conflict. Part of this is their distinct habitats, but drakes are open to negotiating simple agreements between rampages. This courtesy does not extend to dragonets, which drakes happily take as prey. Solitary tamed drakes are also excluded from such agreements and considered free game if their tamer isn't strong enough to protect them.

Drake Eggs

While drake hides aren't any more valuable than those of similarly sized creatures, drake eggs are prized commodities. They are used as components in powerful spells as well as eaten by various cultures, but the most common use for drake eggs is hatching and rearing drakes to serve as mounts and guardians.

A typical drake lays a clutch of 2d4 eggs every 5 years. Eggs hatch within 3 to 6 weeks, during which time they must be kept in conditions appropriate to their natural environment, perhaps the most difficult aspect of drake husbandry. While it is generally easy for breeders to incubate the eggs of desert or jungle drakes (which require mildly warm temperatures to hatch) or river drakes (which must be submerged in running water), the eggs of flame and frost drakes require extreme temperatures in order to hatch, which can be difficult to replicate safely.

A drake egg is an object with Hardness 3, 5 HP, and no Broken Threshold. The coloration of drake eggs varies only slightly from one species to the next. A creature must succeed at a @Check[nature|dc:20] check, or a relevant DC 20 Lore check, to identify the drake species of a specific egg.

Once a drake hatches, they imprint on the first creature that they see. A creature imprinted on in this way can use Nature to Train and Command that drake. The market price of a drake egg varies depending on the type of drake and the exact legal situation. Because drakes are dangerous and intelligent creatures, many societies do not condone the trade of drake eggs and criminalize those who engage in it.

It takes 2 years for a drake hatchling to grow to full size. A well-trained drake can make a fearsome mount or guardian, but many careless would-be drake trainers are devoured by their charges.

jbjsVEFvVsslwVHa.name: Tail Lash
jbjsVEFvVsslwVHa.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the ocean drake's tail uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check.

Effect The ocean drake attempts to Strike the triggering creature with its tail. If it hits, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash}

xheziaVMnj1iAjP5.name: Chthonic Mucus
xheziaVMnj1iAjP5.description:
The ocean drake spits a ball of chthonic mucus up to a range of 50 feet that explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10]. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[4d6[spirit]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save). Those that fail this save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,spirit]] and take a -5-foot status penalty to their Speed. This Speed reduction ends with the persistent spirit damage.

The ocean drake can't use Chthonic Mucus again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Chthonic Mucus]]{1d6 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.campaign-effects.Item.uZ2mAwpVz1bkw5GK]{Effect: Chthonic Mucus}

GsSxwd5EPNBqxdWC.name: Draconic Frenzy
GsSxwd5EPNBqxdWC.description: The river drake makes one Fangs Strike and two Tail Strikes in any order.

qugqAWTLubz9fcj2.name: Speed Surge
qugqAWTLubz9fcj2.description:
Frequency three times per day;

Effect The river drake Strides or Flies twice.

sqGWHUGlTAGhDlrG.name: Fanatical Frenzy
sqGWHUGlTAGhDlrG.description:
Requirements The cultist has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a –2 penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is fatigued.

Enraged Bun the Black.name: Enraged Bun the Black

jbjsVEFvVsslwVHa.name: Tail Lash
jbjsVEFvVsslwVHa.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of Bun the Black's tail uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check

Effect Bun the Black attempts to Strike the triggering creature with their tail. If it hits, the target takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash}

xheziaVMnj1iAjP5.name: Caustic Mucus
xheziaVMnj1iAjP5.description:
Bun the Black spits a ball of caustic mucus up to a range of 50 feet that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[4d8[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). Those that fail this save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,acid]] damage and take a –5-foot status penalty to their Speed. This Speed reduction ends with the persistent acid damage. Bun the Black can't use Caustic Mucus again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Caustic Mucus]]{1d6 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TbmkcfpKIs558skY]{Effect: Caustic Mucus}

GsSxwd5EPNBqxdWC.name: Draconic Frenzy
GsSxwd5EPNBqxdWC.description: Bun the Black makes one fangs Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

qugqAWTLubz9fcj2.name: Speed Surge
qugqAWTLubz9fcj2.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect Bun the Black Strides or Flies twice.

Mordant Spire Plunderer.name: Mordant Spire Plunderer
Mordant Spire Plunderer.description:
A ship's boatswain, or bosun, leads the deckhands who maintain the ship.

Adventurers may need passage on a swift vessel, or they might face danger from raiders at sea or in coastal settlements.

0Z0tfKCoRaKagvVT.name: Pike and Strike
0Z0tfKCoRaKagvVT.description: The plunderer makes a melee Strike with their naval pike. If this Strike hits, the plunderer can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a fist Strike against the target without increasing their multiple attack penalty until after the first Strike.

u6QEft9DxfittKI2.name: Plunderer's Command
u6QEft9DxfittKI2.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The plunderer orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the plunderer's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.WfiaKdXNSxC3POcs]{Effect: Bosun's Command}

Loyal Ort.name: Loyal Ort
Loyal Ort.description:
These shapeless masses of quivering flesh are the least of devilkind. Pathetic creatures from Hell's first layer, orts roam alongside damned and suffering souls. Nessaris can combine the essence of a mob of orts to concentrate their collective wickedness within a single form, granting it an infernal sentience and transforming it into a more powerful devil (see the nessari's Shape Devils ability).

Masters of corruption and architects of conquest, devils seek both to tempt mortal life to join in their pursuit of all things profane and to spread tyranny throughout all worlds. The temptations they offer mortals range from great powers granted by the signing of an infernal contract to twisted favors following a whispered pledge to a diabolic patron, or any number of even subtler exchanges. Those who succumb to these temptations find themselves consigned to an afterlife of endless torment in the pits of Hell, wherein the only hope of escape lies in the chance of being promoted to become a devil in the infernal ranks.

Every devil has a specific role to play in the upkeep of the remorseless bureaucratic machine that is Hell, from soldiers and scholars to inquisitors, lawyers, judges, and executioners. Lowly orts perform subservient labor to more powerful and specialized devils, such as infantry and contract devils, while the greatest nessaris command entire infernal armies.

Asmodeus stands at the apex of the structure he created, but the layers below him are marked by a constant jockeying for position. Most diabolic plans ultimately serve to improve the schemer's place in the hierarchy.

Weak Animated Flame.name: Weak Animated Flame
Weak Animated Flame.description:
Although arguably quite friendly, fire scamps are considered far more dangerous than their kin. They delight in fire and playing pranks on everyone they befriend. Even given time to understand others' dislike of fire, most fire scamps enjoy the feel of flames enough to constantly test their limits.

Compared to the nations of other scamps, the nations on the Plane of Fire are by far the strongest. This backing inspires fire scamps to challenge authority more quickly than the others.

Elemental scamps are bat-like critters marked by elemental powers. Scamps are dispatched from the Elemental Planes by more powerful residents or called to the Universe by neophyte summoners. All scamps have a hint of magical power due to a lingering connection to their home plane, which they largely use to pull simple pranks.

Scamps rapidly form a pecking order of cleverness. Humanoids often confuse scamps when meeting such creatures for the first time. These confused scamps usually resort to an escalating series of pranks and mischief, seeing what they can get away with to establish their place in the hierarchy.

UnZj5Xyb8m8zt4Wk.name: Panic of Failure Foreseen
UnZj5Xyb8m8zt4Wk.description: If the animated flame leaves the village, willingly or otherwise, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} for 2 rounds.

yAvraJf1ksBAcCOl.name: Price of Failure
yAvraJf1ksBAcCOl.description: If the animated flame starts its turn outside the village after it arrives, it dissipates.

JPfXLDy2dYseqUop.name: Smoke Vision
JPfXLDy2dYseqUop.description: The animated flame ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

gMRZ46sjaLERrmao.name: Flame Breath
gMRZ46sjaLERrmao.description:
The animated flame breathes flames in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[(2d4-4)[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]] damage.

The animated flame can't use Flame Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Flame Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Festering Plague Zombie.name: Festering Plague Zombie
Festering Plague Zombie.description:
Plague zombies are infested with horrible contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.name: Slow
a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.name: Zombie Rot
RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately.

TIGzFU4lxbPN1wLr.name: Motion Sense
TIGzFU4lxbPN1wLr.description: An amalgam ooze can feel nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

YgkVvxflxxnTYtDN.name: Body Spout
YgkVvxflxxnTYtDN.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The amalgam ooze spews liquid from its body at a creature, roll [[/gmr 1d6]] to determine the effect using the table below. Each is resisted with a successful @Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save:

1: @Damage[(1d6+2)[acid]] damage

2–3: @Damage[1d6[cold]] damage

4–5: @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage

6: restore @Damage[1d6[healing]] hit points

E8xhvhfUbIfDOmZq.name: Dazzling Surface
E8xhvhfUbIfDOmZq.description:
Requirements The amalgam ooze is targeted by an attack

Effect The multicolored surface of the amalgam ooze shifts rapidly. The attacking creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of its next turn unless it succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:18] save.

PQhHUj7dXqDiETws.name: Blades of Shade
PQhHUj7dXqDiETws.description: Shadow Lesolethe causes the shadows cast by those around her to transform into a mesh of blades which erupt upwards at her foes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Enemy creatures in this area take @Damage[5d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save).

vKHq35aOubDlbfbC.name: Boiling Darkness
vKHq35aOubDlbfbC.description: Shadow-Lesolethe utters a scream which causes shadows to churn and boil. Each living enemy within 30 feet to attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to Boiling Darkness for 1 minute.

INS8hnRRKNGfbWn8.name: Lover's Devotion
INS8hnRRKNGfbWn8.description:
Trigger Luxia would be hit by a melee attack

Effect One of the floating skulls of Luxia's previous lovers interferes with the attack, granting Luxia a +2 circumstance bonus to her AC. The skull is then destroyed. Once all three skulls are destroyed in this way, Luxia can no longer use this reaction.

p2vx0ZdnnU6pMRLS.name: Drain Bonded Item
p2vx0ZdnnU6pMRLS.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Luxia hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect Luxia expends the power stored in her +1 staff. This gives her the ability to cast one prepared spell she had already previously cast today without spending a spell slot. Luxia must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

p9tJDu2GfOJrKKdv.name: Steady Spellcasting
p9tJDu2GfOJrKKdv.description: If a reaction would disrupt Luxia's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Shambling Plague Zombie.name: Shambling Plague Zombie
Shambling Plague Zombie.description:
Plague zombies are infested with horrible contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.name: Slow
a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.name: Zombie Rot
RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately

sqGWHUGlTAGhDlrG.name: Fanatical Frenzy
sqGWHUGlTAGhDlrG.description:
Requirements The cultist has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a –2 penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is fatigued.

Big Katsu.name: Big Katsu
Big Katsu.description:
Ogre gluttons take the act of feeding to a horrific extreme, capable of extending their already cavernous mouths wide enough to gulp down a halfling. Stories of ogre gluttons being tricked into eating razor-edged shields or barrels filled with poisoned meat are common, but such tales are of little consolation to those who have been gobbled whole by these ravenous giants. In addition to their sadistic table manners, ogre gluttons have a disturbing knack for coming up with violent "games" that are little more than drawn-out torments, yet those who somehow manage to beat a glutton at the rules of their own game can often enrage the ogre enough that the resulting tantrum provides an opportunity for the captives to escape.

For many societies, ogres embody brutish, amoral violence and greedy cruelty. Standing 10 feet tall and densely muscled, ogres are usually as strong as they are vicious. The worst ogres are sadists, enjoying remorseless murder, torture, and violence in all of its forms. Although they prefer to vent their violent urges on other humanoids—the smaller the better—ogre captivity can end in a horrifying fate for anyone unlucky enough to fall within their meaty grasp: becoming dinner. But for all their creativity in inflicting pain, ogres often forget that their playthings lack their own robust fortitude and high pain tolerance, and many of their captives die sooner than the ogres might prefer. Meanwhile, those who manage to survive captivity in an ogre's larder often emerge with lasting mental scars. A captive able to keep their wits about them, however, can sometimes trick the brutes by promising treasure, more plentiful food sources, or other crude amusements, taking advantage of an ogre's often-limited intellect to engineer opportunities to escape or gain revenge.

Ogres are social creatures only in the most debased sense. They gather together in groups called families, though members are not always related by blood. The most powerful ogre in any family is the "boss"—usually the family's patriarch or matriarch—whom the other ogres in the family learn to quickly obey or risk being brutalized by the boss's loyal kin. Ogres lair in caves, crumbling ruins, or dilapidated shacks close enough to humanoid settlements or animal trails to make raiding easy. Their lairs are filthy and frequently contain all-too-recognizable evidence of their depravity, along with assorted treasures stolen from past captives.

SzfxfFohnnwRyEeK.name: Glutton's Feast
SzfxfFohnnwRyEeK.description:
If the ogre glutton damages a living creature with their jaws Strike, they gain 1d4 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.ww0Wu8majCej2tVF]{Effect: Glutton's Feast}

DvjFG8xZGQmhN7AK.name: Glutton's Rush
DvjFG8xZGQmhN7AK.description: The ogre glutton Strides twice and makes a jaws Strike. If they damage a living creature with this Strike, the temporary Hit Points they receive from Glutton's Feast is increased to 2d4.

Fs4kRRF969DGHzVA.name: Oni Form
Fs4kRRF969DGHzVA.description: Big Katsu takes on the size and form of an Oni (already reflected in the stat block).

SxuBKaPlLJ3ubWSe.name: Selfish Shield
SxuBKaPlLJ3ubWSe.description:
Trigger An enemy in this creature's champion's aura damages them

Effect This creature gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, regardless of damage type. In addition, their Strikes against the triggering creature deal 1 extra spirit damage until the end of their next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.h6nyMp4dtPXBfCJc]{Effect: Selfish Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.2a6fuugiPpICe3Li]{Effect: Champion's Extra Damage}

wC0EwJj78CkYhtvL.name: Powerful Faith
wC0EwJj78CkYhtvL.description: When the champion of Deskari critically succeeds at a Strike against an enemy with their scythe, their enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and moved 5 feet in the direction of the champion's choice. This is forced movement.
